013package org.apache.juneau.internal;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ArgUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
017import java.lang.reflect.*;
018import java.util.*;
019
020/**
021 * Quick and dirty utilities for working with arrays.
022 *
023 * <ul class='seealso'>
024
025 * </ul>
026 */
027public final class ArrayUtils {
028
029   /**
030    * Appends one or more elements to an array.
031    *
032    * @param <T> The element type.
033    * @param array The array to append to.
034    * @param newElements The new elements to append to the array.
035    * @return A new array with the specified elements appended.
036    */
037   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
038   public static <T> T[] append(T[] array, T...newElements) {
039      if (array == null)
040         return newElements;
041      if (newElements.length == 0)
042         return array;
043      T[] a = (T[])Array.newInstance(array.getClass().getComponentType(), array.length + newElements.length);
044      for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++)
045         a[i] = array[i];
046      for (int i = 0; i < newElements.length; i++)
047         a[i+array.length] = newElements[i];
048      return a;
049   }
050
051   /**
052    * Combine an arbitrary number of arrays into a single array.
053    *
054    * @param <E> The element type.
055    * @param arrays Collection of arrays to combine.
056    * @return A new combined array, or <jk>null</jk> if all arrays are <jk>null</jk>.
057    */
058   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
059   public static <E> E[] combine(E[]...arrays) {
060      assertArgNotNull("arrays", arrays);
061      int l = 0;
062      E[] a1 = null;
063      for (E[] a : arrays) {
064         if (a1 == null && a != null)
065            a1 = a;
066         l += (a == null ? 0 : a.length);
067      }
068      if (a1 == null)
069         return null;
070      E[] a = (E[])Array.newInstance(a1.getClass().getComponentType(), l);
071      int i = 0;
072      for (E[] aa : arrays)
073         if (aa != null)
074            for (E t : aa)
075               a[i++] = t;
076      return a;
077   }
078
079   /**
080    * Converts the specified array to a <c>Set</c>.
081    *
082    * <p>
083    * The order of the entries in the set are the same as the array.
084    *
085    * @param <T> The entry type of the array.
086    * @param array The array being wrapped in a <c>Set</c> interface.
087    * @return The new set.
088    */
089   public static <T> Set<T> asSet(final T[] array) {
090      assertArgNotNull("array", array);
091      return new AbstractSet<T>() {
092
093         @Override /* Set */
094         public Iterator<T> iterator() {
095            return new Iterator<T>() {
096               int i = 0;
097
098               @Override /* Iterator */
099               public boolean hasNext() {
100                  return i < array.length;
101               }
102
103               @Override /* Iterator */
104               public T next() {
105                  if (i >= array.length)
106                     throw new NoSuchElementException();
107                  T t = array[i];
108                  i++;
109                  return t;
110               }
111
112               @Override /* Iterator */
113               public void remove() {
114                  throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not supported.");
115               }
116            };
117         }
118
119         @Override /* Set */
120         public int size() {
121            return array.length;
122         }
123      };
124   }
125
126   /**
127    * Converts the specified collection to an array.
128    *
129    * <p>
130    * Works on both object and primitive arrays.
131    *
132    * @param <E> The element type.
133    * @param c The collection to convert to an array.
134    * @param elementType The component type of the collection.
135    * @return A new array.
136    */
137   public static <E> Object toArray(Collection<?> c, Class<E> elementType) {
138      Object a = Array.newInstance(elementType, c.size());
139      Iterator<?> it = c.iterator();
140      int i = 0;
141      while (it.hasNext())
142         Array.set(a, i++, it.next());
143      return a;
144   }
145
146   /**
147    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is an array.
148    *
149    * @param array The array to test.
150    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is an array.
151    */
152   public static boolean isArray(Object array) {
153      return array != null && array.getClass().isArray();
154   }
155
156   /**
157    * Converts the specified array to an <c>ArrayList</c>
158    *
159    * @param <E> The element type.
160    * @param array The array to convert.
161    * @param elementType
162    *    The type of objects in the array.
163    *    It must match the actual component type in the array.
164    * @return A new {@link ArrayList}
165    */
166   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
167   public static <E> List<E> toList(Object array, Class<E> elementType) {
168      List<E> l = new ArrayList<>(Array.getLength(array));
169      for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(array); i++)
170         l.add((E)Array.get(array, i));
171      return l;
172   }
173
174   /**
175    * Recursively converts the specified array into a list of objects.
176    *
177    * @param array The array to convert.
178    * @return A new {@link ArrayList}
179    */
180   public static List<Object> toObjectList(Object array) {
181      List<Object> l = new ArrayList<>(Array.getLength(array));
182      for (int i = 0; i < Array.getLength(array); i++) {
183         Object o = Array.get(array, i);
184         if (o != null && o.getClass().isArray())
185            o = toObjectList(o);
186         l.add(o);
187      }
188      return l;
189   }
190
191   /**
192    * Copies the specified array into the specified list.
193    *
194    * <p>
195    * Works on both object and primitive arrays.
196    *
197    * @param array The array to copy into a list.
198    * @param list The list to copy the values into.
199    * @return The same list passed in.
200    */
201   @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked","rawtypes"})
202   public static List copyToList(Object array, List list) {
203      if (array != null) {
204         int length = Array.getLength(array);
205         for (int i = 0; i < length; i++)
206            list.add(Array.get(array, i));
207      }
208      return list;
209   }
210
211   /**
212    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified array contains the specified element using the {@link String#equals(Object)}
213    * method.
214    *
215    * @param element The element to check for.
216    * @param array The array to check.
217    * @return
218    *    <jk>true</jk> if the specified array contains the specified element,
219    *    <jk>false</jk> if the array or element is <jk>null</jk>.
220    */
221   public static boolean contains(String element, String[] array) {
222      return indexOf(element, array) != -1;
223   }
224
225   /**
226    * Returns the index position of the element in the specified array using the {@link String#equals(Object)} method.
227    *
228    * @param element The element to check for.
229    * @param array The array to check.
230    * @return
231    *    The index position of the element in the specified array, or
232    *    <c>-1</c> if the array doesn't contain the element, or the array or element is <jk>null</jk>.
233    */
234   public static int indexOf(String element, String[] array) {
235      if (element == null || array == null)
236         return -1;
237      for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++)
238         if (element.equals(array[i]))
239            return i;
240      return -1;
241   }
242
243   /**
244    * Converts the specified collection to an array of strings.
245    *
246    * <p>
247    * Entries are converted to strings using {@link #toString()}.
248    * <jk>null</jk> values remain <jk>null</jk>.
249    *
250    * @param c The collection to convert.
251    * @return The collection as a string array.
252    */
253   public static String[] toStringArray(Collection<?> c) {
254      String[] r = new String[c.size()];
255      int i = 0;
256      for (Object o : c)
257         r[i++] = stringify(o);
258      return r;
259   }
260
261   /**
262    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the following sorted arrays are equals.
263    *
264    * @param a1 Array #1.
265    * @param a2 Array #2.
266    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the following sorted arrays are equals.
267    */
268   public static boolean equals(String[] a1, String[] a2) {
269      if (a1.length != a2.length)
270         return false;
271      for (int i = 0; i < a1.length; i++)
272         if (! StringUtils.eq(a1[i], a2[i]))
273            return false;
274      return true;
275   }
276
277   /**
278    * Makes a copy of the specified array.
279    *
280    * @param array The array to copy.
281    * @param <T> The element type.
282    * @return A new copy of the array, or <jk>null</jk> if the array was <jk>null</jk>.s
283    */
284   public static <T> T[] copyOf(T[] array) {
285      return array == null ? null : Arrays.copyOf(array, array.length);
286   }
287
288   /**
289    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified array is not null and has a length greater than zero.
290    *
291    * @param array The array to check.
292    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified array is not null and has a length greater than zero.
293    */
294   public static final boolean isNotEmptyArray(Object[] array) {
295      return array != null && array.length > 0;
296   }
297
298   /**
299    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified array is null or has a length of zero.
300    *
301    * @param array The array to check.
302    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified array is null or has a length of zero.
303    */
304   public static final boolean isEmptyArray(Object[] array) {
305      return array == null || array.length == 0;
306   }
307
308   /**
309    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if both specified arrays are null or have a length of zero.
310    *
311    * @param array1 The array to check.
312    * @param array2 The array to check.
313    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified array is null or has a length of zero.
314    */
315   public static final boolean isEmptyArray(Object[] array1, Object[] array2) {
316      return isEmptyArray(array1) && isEmptyArray(array2);
317   }
318
319   /**
320    * Reverses the entries in an array.
321    *
322    * @param <E> The element type.
323    * @param array The array to reverse.
324    * @return The same array.
325    */
326   public static final <E> E[] reverse(E[] array) {
327      for (int i = 0; i < array.length / 2; i++) {
328         E temp = array[i];
329         array[i] = array[array.length - i - 1];
330         array[array.length - i - 1] = temp;
331      }
332      return array;
333   }
334}
